intro: Oreocharis pumila, commonly known as the dwarf oreocharis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Oreocharis pumila thrives in cool, shaded environments and prefers well-drained, moist soil. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
